edu.uncc.cs.bridges

Class AbstractEdge<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.uncc.cs.bridges.AbstractEdge<T>
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Comparable<AbstractEdge<T>>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    BSTEdge, DLListEdge, Edge, QueueEdge, StackEdge

    public class AbstractEdge<T>
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Comparable<AbstractEdge<T>>

      AbstractEdge<T> setWeight(AbstractVertex<T> source, AbstractVertex<T> destination, java.lang.String random)
      Sets a hashcode value based on the string hashcode of source and destination, to the weight attribute of the edge Syntax: A.createEdge(B, "hashCodeWeight"); Default width is provided in the following format For weights less than 4 the width is 1 pixel For weights less than 7 the width is 3 pixel For weights of other values greater than or equal to 7 the width is 5 pixel Syntax for creating a random weight: source.createEdge(target,"hashCodeWeight");
      AbstractEdge<T> setWeight(double weight)
      Sets the weight of the edge Default width is provided in the following format For weights less than 4 the width is 1 pixel For weights less than 7 the width is 3 pixel For weights of other values greater than or equal to 7 the width is 5 pixel Syntax: A.createEdge(B, 10); weight is specified as an integer when creating an edge Optional: A.getEdge(B).setWeight(25); here, weight is set after creating the edge
      AbstractEdge<T> setWidth(double pixels)
      Set the width in pixels

      • getIdentifier

        public T getIdentifier()

      • getWeight

        public double getWeight()
        Get the width in pixels

      • setWeight

        public AbstractEdge<T> setWeight(double weight)
        Sets the weight of the edge Default width is provided in the following format For weights less than 4 the width is 1 pixel For weights less than 7 the width is 3 pixel For weights of other values greater than or equal to 7 the width is 5 pixel Syntax: A.createEdge(B, 10); weight is specified as an integer when creating an edge Optional: A.getEdge(B).setWeight(25); here, weight is set after creating the edge
        Parameters:
        weight - is a double

      • setWeight

        public AbstractEdge<T> setWeight(AbstractVertex<T> source,
                        AbstractVertex<T> destination,
                        java.lang.String random)
        Sets a hashcode value based on the string hashcode of source and destination, to the weight attribute of the edge Syntax: A.createEdge(B, "hashCodeWeight"); Default width is provided in the following format For weights less than 4 the width is 1 pixel For weights less than 7 the width is 3 pixel For weights of other values greater than or equal to 7 the width is 5 pixel Syntax for creating a random weight: source.createEdge(target,"hashCodeWeight");
        Parameters:
        weight - is the string "hashCodeWeight"
        source - contains the source Vertex
        source - contains the destination Vertex
        random - contains the String value "hashCodeWeight" later transformed in random double based on the String identifiers of source and destination vertices for a given edge

      • getColor

        public java.lang.String getColor()
        Get the color, according to CSS formats. By default, the color will be chosen at random. Setting the color to null or "" resets to defaults.
        Parameters:
        color - Color as a String
        See Also:
        Validation.validateColor(String)

      • setColor

        public AbstractEdge<T> setColor(java.lang.String color)
        Set the color, according to CSS formats. By default, the color will be chosen at random. Setting the color to null or "" resets to defaults.
        Parameters:
        color - Color as a String
        See Also:
        Validation.validateColor(String)

        public java.lang.String getDash()
        Get the dash array
        Returns:
        CSS dash array, for example "5,10,5"

      • setDash

        public AbstractEdge<T> setDash(double[] dashes)
        Set the dash array, effectively choosing patterns of dots and dashes for edges.
        Parameters:
        dash - CSS dash double array, for example "5,10,5"

        Get the width in pixels

      • getOpacity

        public double getOpacity()
        Get the edge's current opacity 0.0 is invisible 1.0 is opaque

        public AbstractEdge<T> setOpacity(double opacity)
        Set the edge opacity 0.0 is invisible 1.0 is opaque
        Parameters:
